intro: Potentilla levieri, commonly known as the alpine potentilla, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches a height of about 15–30 centimeters. The plant features small, five-petaled flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, blooming in late summer. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Potentilla levieri is well adapted to harsh alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
